sense.def:
A pin
je zelo majhen tanek koničast kos kovine, s katerim spnemo kose blaga.

To pin something somewhere
pomeni nekaj nekam pritrditi z buciko, risalnim žebljičkom ali varnostno zaponko.

seg.quote: She wore a white rose pinned to her blouse.

sense.def:
To pin someone in a particular position
pomeni nekoga tako trdno pritiskati ob zid ali drugo oporo, da se ne more ganiti.

seg.quote: His strong arms were around me, pinning me down.

sense.def:
To pin the blame for something on someone
pomeni trditi, da je nekdo kriv za nekaj ali da je povzročil nekaj;

seg.quote: You can't pin that on me.

sense.def:
To pin one's hopes on something
pomeni upati, da bo nekaj uspešno.

seg.quote: He pinned his hopes on the prospect of a split in the opposition party.

sense.def:
To pin down something
pomeni natančno povedati, kaj je nekaj, kar je težko opisati, ali kakšno je.

seg.quote: The courts have found obscenity impossible to pin down as a punishable offence.

sense.def:
To pin someone down
pomeni prisiliti nekoga, da se natančno opredeli.

seg.quote: He was anxious to pin the Minister down to some definite commitment.

sense.def:
To pin up a poster or notice
pomeni pritrditi plakat ali obvestilo na steno.

To pin up a piece of clothing
pomeni pripeti spodnji del oblačila više.
